intro: Ferula baluchistanica, commonly known as the Balochistan ferula, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Pakistan and Afghanistan. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces a large, hollow, aromatic fruit that contains numerous seeds. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and limited water availability. Due to its ecological significance and potential medicinal uses, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
